definition: to win/to gain
to beat/to win/to profit
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished

sentences.english: He won a few headers and calmed things down.
sentences.chinese: 贏得了幾次頭球爭頂並且使情況穩定下來。

sentences.english: Don't bet on winning the game.
sentences.chinese: 不要以爲能僥倖贏得比賽。

sentences.english: This is where the future will be won.
sentences.chinese: 這纔是我們贏得未來的基礎。

sentences.english: Well, we ended up walloping them. We took every weight class.
sentences.chinese: 所以我們最終大敗他們，贏得了所有重量級的比賽。

sentences.english: Boxing is about respect - getting it for yourself and taking it away from the other guy.
sentences.chinese: 拳擊是關於尊嚴，贏得你自己的，同時也剝奪別人的。

sentences.english: He won many hearts by his gallantry.
sentences.chinese: 他以勇敢贏得芳心無數。

sentences.english: Hargett sank the ball with his brother’s 9 iron to win the prize.
sentences.chinese: 哈蓋特用他兄弟的球杆揮杆進洞贏得了獎金。

sentences.english: I congratulate my neighbor, whose son has just won the election.
sentences.chinese: 我祝賀我的鄰居，他的兒子剛剛贏得選舉。

sentences.english: He who does not hope to won has already lost.
sentences.chinese: 不希望贏得人已經輸了。

sentences.english: Ma won a debate competition for Asian college students 22 years ago.
sentences.chinese: 早在22年前，他就贏得“亞洲大專辯論會”的獎盃。

sentences.english: I jumped as high as I could so that I could won the competition.
sentences.chinese: 我跳得老高，這樣的話我就可以贏得比賽了。

sentences.english: Because of his long-term unremitting efforts, he finally won his the laurel of "The Sage of Calligraphy".
sentences.chinese: 長期堅持不懈的努力，終於使他贏得“書聖”的桂冠。

sentences.english: Her drive and determination won her a place close to Murdoch.
sentences.chinese: 她的幹勁和決心爲她贏得了接近默多克的位置。

sentences.english: And that's how Allied mathletes helped win the war.
sentences.chinese: 盟軍的數學夢之隊就這樣助他們贏得了二戰勝利。

sentences.english: China wins ping- pong mixed doubles.
sentences.chinese: 中國選手贏得了乒乓混合雙打。

sentences.english: If I win the election, I will carry out God's will.
sentences.chinese: 如果我贏得這次選舉，我會替天行道。

definition: to obtain/to receive/to get
special glory/distinction/rare honor/one's laurels/it's a privilege (to meet you)
to rely on/to depend on/by means of/thanks to/sth that one relies on/also written 憑借|凭借[ping2 jie4]
champion/CL:個|个[ge4]
to seize/to take away forcibly/to wrest control of/to compete or strive for/to force one's way through/to leave out/to lose
a move/an action/in one move/at a stroke/in one go
competition (sports etc)/match/CL:場|场[chang3],次[ci4]/to compete
to found/to create
to fight for/to strive for/to win over
competition (e.g. sporting)
to become/to turn into
to defeat/to overpower/to beat/to be defeated
domestic and international/at home and abroad
to fight over/to contest/to vie over
award/prize/CL:項|项[xiang4]
to come out/to emerge/to reveal/to display
